intro: Calyptranthes decandra, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Calyptranthes decandra is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
